abstract: Editorial urges Congress to approve legislation that would direct 80 percent of the civil penalties from the BP oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico to projects to help replenish and repair the damaged coastal ecosystem; warns that scientists say that there is not much time left to reverse the damage before the task becomes insurmountable.
snippet: Fines from the BP oil spill should be used for long-promised environmental restoration.
lead_paragraph: Fines from the BP oil spill should be used for long-promised environmental restoration.

headline.print_headline: Future of the Gulf: Fines from the BP spill should be used for long-promised environmental restoration
